name: CoinFileInput
brief: Abstract base class for file input classes.

methods.name: haveGzipSupport
methods.brief: indicates whether CoinFileInput supports gzip'ed files

methods.name: haveBzip2Support
methods.brief: indicates whether CoinFileInput supports bzip2'ed files

methods.name: create
methods.brief: Factory method, that creates a CoinFileInput (more precisely a subclass of it) for the file specified.
methods.detailed: This method reads the first few bytes of the file and determines if this is a compressed or a plain file and returns the correct subclass to handle it. If the file does not exist or uses a compression not compiled in an exception is thrown.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The file that should be read.

methods.name: CoinFileInput
methods.brief: Constructor (don't use this, use the create method instead).

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of the file used by this object.

methods.name: read
methods.brief: Read a block of data from the file, similar to fread.

parameters.name: buffer
parameters.description: Address of a buffer to store the data into.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of bytes to read (buffer should be large enough).

methods.name: gets
methods.brief: Reads up to (size-1) characters an stores them into the buffer, similar to fgets.
methods.detailed:
Reading ends, when EOF or a newline occurs or (size-1) characters have been read. The resulting string is terminated with '\0'. If reading ends due to an encoutered newline, the '
' is put into the buffer, before the '\0' is appended.
methods.return_desc: buffer on success, or 0 if no characters have been read.

parameters.name: buffer
parameters.description: The buffer to put the string into.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the buffer in characters.

methods.name: fileAbsPath
methods.brief: Test if the given string looks like an absolute file path.
methods.detailed: The criteria are:unix: string begins with /windows: string begins with ’ or with drv: (drive specifier)

methods.name: fileCoinReadable
methods.brief: Test if the file is readable, using likely versions of the file name, and return the name that worked.
methods.detailed:
The file name is constructed from `name` using the following rules: An absolute path is not modified.
If the name begins with ~, an attempt is made to replace ~ with the value of the environment variable HOME.
If a default prefix (`dfltPrefix`) is provided, it is prepended to the name.
If the constructed file name cannot be opened, and CoinUtils was built with support for compressed files, fileCoinReadable will try any standard extensions for supported compressed files.
The value returned in `name` is the file name that actually worked.
